title: From one bronzie to all the others...
body: Stop using champions that take skill like {{champion:103}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:114}} and {{champion:64}}, not only are they subpar at the moment and not really rewarding but they also bring very little to the team when behind, learn to play the game first then pick something that takes skill, us actually skilled bronzies will thank you for it.

replies.body: I'm a really bad bronze but you have to admit {{champion:103}}  doesn't take that much skill. She is the only character i have a decent win rate with.

The skill is in landing the E, and positioning yourself so your Q always returns over your opponent. You can miss the initial pass, but landing the return on the Q is the important part.

The ult and W are just simple "mash these buttons to nuke your opponent".
Activate e land charm and then q while ulting after each spell. That takes a bit of skill.

Not a bad point man, Although it seems to be better if people play Meta champs, So at the moment Darius, Garen etc. Easy to play and easy to carry. 

People get so worked up with all the LCS and how the pros play that we forget how much skill certain champs take. People running around trying to play difficult champs like Lee Sin, Draven and Cassiopeia just seems silly. I love Lee Sin although i wont play him in Ranked.
Watch out, telling people what to play and what not to play is bad, apparently.
after watching bronze thoughts on youtube i respect all of you. you guys have the tempers of saints. i woulld rage and get banned in a single game.
It really is an exercise of pure mind over matter, I try to remain as level-headed as I can.
if they're not trying to win you can consider them feeding
